dialogue.raw_text: : 73   INT. POOL HALL - LONG SHOT - DAY                              73 of a nearly empty pool hall. One guy plays alone in the far corner of the room. Tilley comes down the stairs of the pool hall and starts to walk toward the back rooms -- CAMERA FOLLOWS him. He opens the door and goes through. 74   INT. GIBRALTAR ALUMINUM SIDING COMPANY                        74 CAMERA CONTINUES TO FOLLOW him INTO the offices of Gibraltar Aluminum Siding Company. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We PASS BY THREE GIRLS on telephones -- they are solicit- ing jobs for the salesmen. CAMERA GOES FROM one Girl TO the other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 77   EXT. TOBACCO WAREHOUSE - DAY                                  77 Moe and BB are walking away from the warehouse toward BB's car... AWAY FROM CAMERA.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to 1. Tilley taps his forehead, with his eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Third race, I see a six... I see a three. I don't think the verdict's in on that one yet. Tilley stands up and is going through his money and race tickets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wing paid a hundred on number five, he loses, I got hundred and forty... next race I'll lay down the bet. (beat) What you taking in this   race?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thrifty's Delight -- number four -- 20 bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take Thrifty's Delight -- 20 bucks, I got 20 on Mr. Motor, Wing's got a hundred on Night Fire. What's the odds on Night Fire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty to one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see Night Fire winning. Fuck it, I'm not gonna even place the bet... I just made a hundred bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, crazy?   What happens if he wins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not gonna win... I feel it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 79   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Wing, we're sitting just off the left of the entrance. I'm gonna lay down your bet right now. See you in a minute. You lost the first race, in case you don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 80   EXT. STREET - DAY                                         80 BB's Cadillac is moving along the street. CUT TO: 81   INT. BB'S CADILLAC - DAY                                  81 BB is behind the wheel, Moe is beside him in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you something, she's getting on my nerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who, Nora?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah... who else is it gonna be... 'who, Nora"!... who else is there? (beat) The whole idea of being with a girl on consecutive nights is new to me. It's one thing when they're with you for a night, but when they live with ya, it's stretching the point. They got a lot of things they bring with them... you go to the bathroom you see 'things' you never saw before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what's the todo? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 81   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, they move your stuff around and it's not where it used to be... I'm not used to that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean all this time you've never lived with a girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?! Did we just meet? How long we been partners? No, I've never lived with a girl!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, oh boy! Did you wake up on the wrong side of the bed today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I did. I came in  last night, she was sleeping on my side of the bed. In my life I  never got out of bed on the left side... in my life, never from the left. (beat; he looks out of the car window) I got close once up in the Catskills. I met this  girl, Dorian. For a week we  were together, but it wasn't the same because she always went to her room to change and do all that stuff. She didn't  have things in my room. BB gives a big sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this 'cos I'm trying to get even with some guy. (beat) You know what? I think I got to see her and put an end to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 82   INT. SOCIAL SECURITY OFFICE - DAY                             82 We see hundreds of secretaries typing away, and clerks sitting at desks. BB walks into the office, peeking his head around the corner, feeling a little uncomfortable. He starts to walk around trying to find Nora out of all the secretaries and clerks. (CONTINUED) 75. 82   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (she smiles and yells) Bill! BB turns towards Nora. Nora waves to him, happily, with a twinkle in her eye. BB feels conspicuous -- people are looking at him. He gives a little wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 83   INT. SOCIAL SECURITY OFFICE - COFFEE AREA                        83 Nora gives BB a small kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you stopped by.     This is a real surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I got a problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.    How can I help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... er... (realizing    that she didn't quite get    the point) Well, the problem    is... like... is like... eh, you    know... you're the problem. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 83   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. How so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's things that are bothering me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know... things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, like things that come up... stuff... like... you know, annoyances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annoyances?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to explain... very hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As an example... I came home last night, I get undressed, and I realize you're sleeping on my side of the bed. I've always slept on that side... it's something I've always done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why didn't you just nudge me a bit and tell me to go and sleep on the other side?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to wake you up... I thought you might think it was kind of stupid or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's easily changed. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 83   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there are other things... bigger things. But I realize just talking about it, they all sound petty and silly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, if you think all of this is going too fast, maybe I should move out. Is that what you want, Bill? BB looks around, very uncomfortable, and he shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really care for you, but if you think it's best. (beat) I don't want to make you unhappy. After a long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we've got to take drastic action. Nora smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought I'd come by and get things off my chest... talk it out. (beat) Listen, I'm going over to Pimlico... catch the seventh race... wanna come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't get away from work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. He goes to walk away, then turns back and gives her a quick kiss. He turns and walks away. Nora watches him as he walks by the rows and rows of secretaries and clerks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 84   INT. TURF CLUB AT RACETRACK - CLOSEUP OF TILLEY - DAY         84 watching a race. (CONTINUED) 78. 84   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're taking a thirty-to-one shot... number eight... come on number eight... 'Streamers...' come on, you sucker!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 87 Tilley is still yelling for his horse, Sam and Wing watch quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-to-one... a hundred bucks on you, number eight. There's a guy up here who put a hundred on ya. Come on... come on... come on, baby... come on, baby! 88   EXT. RACETRACK - FINISH LINE - DAY                           88 Another horse -- number 14 -- races past the winning post.

direction.raw_text: 89 TILLEY Nooooooo! (CONTINUED)

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 91   INT. TURF CLUB - ANGLE ON WING, SAM AND TILLEY - DAY          91 WING (smiles) Very nice!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was your horse, Wing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Southern Belle. You oughta know, you bet her for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Wing goes to look at form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna go with the favorite in this one -- Fordnee Lane. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 91   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you what, I    won sixteen plus on the other    race, from those winnings you    can bet me eight hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight hundred?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I wanna bet eight hundred on Fordnee Lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fordnee lane -- eight hundred. Sam is looking at Tilley knowing that he's really in a jam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waiter, can you get me a cup of coffee? Tilley looks over to Sam, with panic on his face.    Wing turns back to Tilley and Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys want anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Er... hum... er... hey, Wing... I tell you, I got a problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the eight hundred on Fordnee Lane. I haven't got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you got it wrong. You take it from the sixteen plus I won... the eight hundred. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 91   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't got the winnings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do ya mean, you don't have my winnings?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wing, it was the craziest thing... I didn't want to mention it earlier because it was so nuts... it was the craziest thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how to even tell you this without being embarrassed for myself. It was an accident... it's like one of those things out of the blue... it's crazy... you can't explain it... it happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, what is he talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had an accident of some sort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It happens... I don't know how... I don't know how to explain. It's too crazy, I swear to God, Wing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute... you're telling me that I didn't win the last race?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won, Wing... you won, it's just that you're not getting any money... it was a fluke. I swear, I don't know how it could have happened. A ten-year-old couldn't have made the mistake I made... I don't know, I swear. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 91   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is he talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there was some way I could make it up, believe me, I would, because you know where I stand. There's a beat while Wing just looks at Tilley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know where I stand, Wing. If there was any way, believe me, I'd make it up. I'd give you thirty percent of what you didn't get because it was a fluke... I'm willing to make some kind of retribution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just pocketed the God damned money... you just took my money and slipped it into your God damned pocket, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'd split fifty-fifty with you, that's how badly I feel under the circumstances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get this straight, you son of a bitch, you owe me sixteen plus... I want sixteen plus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I trying to shirk my responsibility? That's not the way I see it... it was a fluke, a crazy thing that happened, but I stand behind my honor on this... put it on my tab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What  the hell is wrong with him? What  the hell is wrong with him? He's  stealing money from me... what  the hell is wrong with him? Can  you tell me? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 91   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know the whole story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You work with him, Sam... for Christ sake... Wing is totally frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, wrong? It was a fluke... it was an accident. I don't know what the hell went wrong. It was a one-in-a-million thing that happened to me when I went to place that bet. I'm trying to do what I can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tilley, what the hell happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 92   EXT. RACETRACK - LATE AFTERNOON                               92 Tilley and Sam are leaving the racetrack and walking to Tilley's Cadillac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you at least give him the six hundred that you pocketed from the six races he lost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck him! It's on my tab. At least I've got six hundred in my pocket right now. It's like another loan. Sam, you got to think about today. Today, I got six hundred bucks in my pocket. You know what I'm saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 92   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like some guy trying to sell me life insurance. You think I'm gonna take some money out of my pocket to give to some jerk so that somebody can take it when I'm dead? No, Sam, you gotta live for today. I'm gonna live as good as I can every day. You know what I'm saying? As Sam and Tilley walk towards Tilley's Cadillac, BB and Moe are walking to BB's Cadillac parked close to Tilley's car. They see each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mr. Marengay went to the track!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you bother to bet, or did you just hand your money to the tellers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sarcasm's killing me. (beat) I thought you were looking to get even.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's your accountant, mister, 'cos I think you're down in the debit side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's stuck with my wife.   You or me? He laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to believe that you were setting me up with your wife as some kind of decoy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Decoy is the word! There's a long beat as the two guys eye one another. Then, almost in a soft apologetic manner, BB speaks. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 92   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay then, you win. BB gets into his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I win? (to Sam) That guy would never let me win. He must be setting me up. The son of a bitch is setting me up, Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For crying out loud, why don't you just leave it at that... you win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't have won. (beat) I smell a rat. BB's car pulls away.    Tilley and Sam watch him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're getting a little humility in your blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If getting Nora is part of losing, Thank God I didn't win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 95   INT. TOBACCO WAREHOUSE - OFFICE - DAY                        95 This is the office of the Home Improvement Commission. Desks, chairs and filing cabinets are all over the place (not yet organized) and boxes and cartons are stacked against a wall. ANGLE ON John Masters walking with a file under his arm. He walks across the half-empty warehouse where workers are renovating the space. He approaches a table where Stanley is seated with his feet up, nursing a hot cup of coffee. Masters throws a file down on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is good, Stan... nice work. Stanley nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fossey says it should go down very well with the city council. Could help us appropriate more funds. This goes a long way to establish our credibility in what we're trying to do. We hear a LOUD, SAWING noise and HAMMERING echoing through the warehouse throughout this scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a lot more where this came from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I think you should do now. Why don't you pull some files... some files that were completed, others that went unsold, and I'll have somebody run it down, talk to the customers and get some statements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulling files is another thing. That might not be easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To sneak a few here and there when you can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that might be good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 96   EXT. STREET - NIGHT                                          96 BB's Cadillac is parked in front of a house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think if we made this one of our factory showcase houses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a good location... get a lot of traffic on this street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean, Mr. Gable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I do, Alan? I pick certain houses that are strategically located, we put up the aluminum siding, and for every referral, for every person who sees this quality job that we do... sees how beautiful it is... I give you two hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hundred dollars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. God knows how many homes we could sell by people passing this house. It's perfectly placed for that. (taking out his wallet) Alan, this is how confident I feel that this house will drum up business for me. He peels off four hundred dollars and hands the money to Shubner. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 97   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four hundred dollars... I'm giving you commission on two house referrals before I put a panel on the side of your house... that's how confident I feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think that many people are going to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm certain of it. I'm not giving away four hundred dollars for my health... I'm a businessman, and I'm a good businessman. This is good business for me. I'm giving it away 'cos I believe in this house, believe that it will refer me to other jobs which means money in my pocket, which means money in your pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a deal, Mr. Gable. BB smiles.   Suddenly Moe winces in pain.

direction.raw_text: Something wrong, sir? Moe collapses to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I finally got hold of May... she was over your sister's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I forgot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be down here shortly. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 98   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have any insurance. If I die, May's got nothing... nothing... nothing for Leonard. The only money I've got is in my pocket. That's all I got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just take it easy, Moe... rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they sign?     Did they sign?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn it, BB! Did you sign them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry... don't worry.     I'll take care of it tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn, my chest hurts. (beat) I always taught you, BB, never walk out of a place without a signed contract. Somebody's word ain't spit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll sign, Moe.    Don't worry, they'll sign. They round the bend of the corridor.

direction.raw_text: : 99   INT. HOSPITAL HALLWAY                                            99 BB is on a public phone to Nora.     We never see Nora, we just hear her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is kind of   new to me, but I thought I better   call and tell you I'm gonna be   late... maybe two or three. I    never had anyone there to   call before, but I thought I   should call, you know. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 99    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Do you think you have some obligation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno... I thought I'd better call, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm glad you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what's gonna happen to Moe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I hope he's okay. (beat) I'll see you when you get in. She gives BB a kiss on the phone.

direction.raw_text: Yeah. He hangs up the phone and walks to a room opposite. He opens the door and stands in the doorway looking at Moe who is lying beneath an oxygen tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 100   INT. DINER - DAY                                             100 Tilley, Sam, Mouse and Gil are sitting in a booth having just finished breakfast.

direction.raw_text: Let me see what the damage is. (he reaches for the bill, hums as he reads) Babum... babum... babum... babum... He hands the bill to Mouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouse, figure it out, will ya?

direction.raw_text: Why don't we just split it five ways? (CONTINUED)

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way! He's a pig! He always eats more than anyone else. Why should I pay for his food?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you talking about? Today I happened to have eggs and flapjacks, some cantalope, some juice and then another juice.

direction.raw_text: Like an animal! Like an animal!

direction.raw_text: What did he have? (turning to Sam) Sam, what did he have?

direction.raw_text: Well I don't remember what he had. Gil, what did he have?

direction.raw_text: Pancakes?
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what did you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 100   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this, a quiz show? We don't know what you had. What did you have?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't have that much... doesn't anybody remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't remember, I don't know why.

direction.raw_text: I could have sworn he had pancakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he didn't have pancakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you a clue... maple syrup was used.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: French toast. There's a KNOCK at the window of the diner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: French toast?    He had more than French toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but not a lot more. We hear further RAPPING on the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a damn... it's split five ways. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 100   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wife's knocking on the window here. Tilley looks to the window, acknowledges Nora and points to the far end of the diner, she nods and starts walking across the front of the diner to the door. 101   INT. DINER - DAY                                              101 Nora and Tilley are sitting alone at a table drinking coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was not long ago you never would have seen a woman in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to tell me. How many nights did you drop me off and come up here all the time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I was just trying to be congenial... you know, start a conversation off, on a nice kind of light level, you know. So, what's the scoop, Nora?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you know, I think we really should get divorced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makes sense.   You want some more coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'll have some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Florence, some coffee here. (to Nora) It's for the best. (beat) You know, we were kind of fooling ourselves, weren't we? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 101   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it went wrong somewhere along the line -- I don't know where though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, something went wrong... I don't know. Florence walks over and pours coffee for Tilley and Nora, then walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you like this guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All in all I guess it'll all work out for the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you feel that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, can you figure it out? A guy bangs into my car, thinks I did him in, tries to get even with me by stealing my wife, you two people fall in love... can you figure that out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You telling me you didn't know this was the guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was that guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I told you I ran into another tin man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't tell me he was a tin man... he told me he sold baby pictures. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 101   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your life. All I know is this guy has a bent weather vane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God!   Not another tin man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 102   INT. SUPERIOR ALUMINUM SIDING COMPANY OFFICE - DAY            102 We see and hear the Girls working the telephones, as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon, this is Superior Aluminum Siding. We're going to have...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... a salesman in your area today... BB is sitting in a chair across from Looney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beeb, why don't you let Stanley work with you. I'm off to Florida at the end of the week for some sun and fun. Let Stanley work with you, and when I get back, we'll see how Moe's doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. To be honest with you, I think I'd rather work alone ... he's too green. Is he a pain in the ass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He don't talk much; he's a good listener, so he can't really get on your nerves. He's a lousy pool player and he can't play cards for shit, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what good is he? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 102   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Studious type... takes a lot of notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If this is a sales pitch, I think you got to work a little harder 'cos I don't think you've got good product.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 103   EXT. INDUSTRIAL WAREHOUSE - ANGLE ON BB - DAY                     103 As he comes out of the Superior Aluminum building and walks towards his car. We see Nora driving her Chevy in front of BB's car. She drives her car forward, and then reverses it hard into BB's Cadillac. He runs over to the driver's side of Nora's Chevy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, crazy?! Nora drives the car forward and then backwards again almost running BB down. She rolls down the window (auto- matically) so that she can yell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a goddamn tin man! Then she backs the car up.      BB tries to go around the front of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute!     Wait a minute! Nora starts to move the car towards him. He moves away, and her car smashes into the side of his car. She presses the button to the window and rolls it down just a shade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to win me just to get even with my husband... screw you! She rolls up the window, floors the car, and drives away. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 103   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he walks out of the building.   He sees BB's car all smashed up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you ought to get rid of this car... it's bad luck. Nora's CAR SCREECHES around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that the guy again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's some kind of sickness that runs in that family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 104   INT. POOL HALL - TIGHT SHOT OF MOUSE - DAY                    104 He's singing "The Banana Boat Song."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Day-O! da,da,da,da,day... daylight come and he wanna go home...' ANGLE ON TILLEY AND GIL at a table playing pool. Mouse is standing next to his trusted JUKEBOX, belting out his favorite Harry Belafonte song. In b.g.:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't they get rid of that fucking record? It's not a hit anymore... nobody cares about this song anymore... it's history. Mouse continue singing in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Day-O!   da,da,da,da,day...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can always smash the juke box, or break in and steal the record. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 104   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's getting on my nerves. The guy eats like an animal, and sings like an asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's me, but I'm beginning to like it. Tilley hits the ball and sinks the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir... yes, sir! ANGLE ON SAM He comes out of the back room into the pool hall, and walks over to the table where Tilley and Gil are playing pool. He drops an open envelope onto the pool table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look at this crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? They're not gonna leave me alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home Improvement Commission. With those words there's a genuine moment of concern from all of the tin men -- even Mouse stops singing. Tilley picks up the envelope and pulls out the letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to appear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that's the gist of what they're saying. Gil looks over Tilley's shoulder at the letter.    Mouse comes over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Christ!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't we just ignore it? How do they know we got the letter. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 104   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's certified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think, Sam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno... I don't know what they've got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is this happening? Am I paranoid or something? I mean, why is this happening? The government is after me... the state is after me... Mr. Marengay ... somebody is always after me. What the hell's going on here? I'm just this guy. What's the big deal? They can't get along without me? The government can't operate unless they've got Tilley's money... the Commission's after my job! This shit's driving me insane! All the lying, thieving, stealing corporations in this world, and the IRS takes the time to come for me? There's billions of dollars out there but they've got to come and get Tilley's four thousand dollars! (turning to Mouse) Turn off the fucking Belafonte song now, or I'm gonna break the goddamn machine!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BB is sitting at the bar, getting drunk. Stanley sits next to him. A girl approaches (RUTHIE).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Beeb, let's dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not tonight, Ruthie, my dancing shoes are on holiday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm more than sure. Ruthie moves off. BB takes a shot of whiskey and downs it, and then drinks some beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was the best you ever saw?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best I ever saw?   Best tin man I ever saw? He holds up his shot glass towards the bartender, and the bartender fills it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry Apel... Dandy Flynn... those guys had good lines, but they burned themselves out too fast. Best? Moe's the best... the best there ever was. If he's in the door, he's got a sale. The best closer ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's some of the hustles he used to pull? BB downs another shot glass of whisky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God damn Nora... God damn Nora! I'm trying to adjust... I'm putting up with things I never put up with in my life. I mean, give me a break... give me a break, woman. Stanely wants to get back to the topic of best tin man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what are a couple of things you and Moe have done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was getting to be real pleasant ... figure that. (long beat) More than pleasant. To hell with her! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come Moe's so good?   Why do you think, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great man, Moe. Great man. BB holds out his glass again to the bartender who refills it. BB downs the shot and drinks more beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why they're so irrational... chicks. I dunno. I think it's because air gets inside 'em. (beat) She probably went back home, to her husband. (looks at his watch) Eleven-thirty... he wouldn't be home yet. (takes out a $10 bill from his wallet) This outght to cover it, Stanley. He puts the $10 bill down on the bar and walks out of the club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 106   EXT. STREET - NIGHT                                         106 Sam's Cadillac moving along a row of houses. CUT TO: 107   INT. CADILLAC - NIGHT                                       107 Sam is driving the car, Tilley is in the passenger seat, very drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got no right. You know what I'm saying, Sam? They've got no right. Tilley takes a drink from a pint of whisky he has open. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 107   CONTINUED:                                                      107 SAM They've got nothing concrete against us, because if it's just hearsay stuff, it's neither here nor there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's my car? What happened to my car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's better I drop you off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't here. He gets out of the car and looks around the street some more. He stumbles up to a couple of parked cars, look- ing for Nora's car. He falls into some trash cans in front of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew I    could smell a rat! The son of a    bitch is coming for me... the son    of a bitch never wants to leave me    alone! Tilley walks over to the night table, opens the drawer and pulls out a revolver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 111     EXT. STREET - NIGHT                                           111 BB making his way up the front stairs to Tilley's house. CUT TO: 112     INT. TILLEY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                   112 Tilley makes his way down the stairs, and creeps to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You   want to rob my God damn house? I'm   gonna make it easy for you. (unlocks the door and leaves it ajar) Come   and rob Tilley... come on... take   everything he's got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 113     EXT. FRONT DOOR OF TILLEY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                     113 BB knocks on the door. The door swings open.      He waits a moment, unsure as to what to do. CUT TO: 11436   INT. TILLEY'S HOUSE - OTHER SIDE OF FRONT DOOR                114 Tilley stands behind the door with the gun, waiting.     BB steps inside the house. (CONTINUED) 104. 114   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hel... Before he can finish the word "Hello," Tilley hits him hard in the head with the butt of the gun. BB falls to the ground unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 115   INT. TILLY'S HOUSE                                            115 BLACK SCREEN. Then a light goes on, and we see the in- side of a refrigerator. PULL BACK to reveal Tilley at the refrigerator in the kitchen of his home. He is putting eggs and rotten tomatoes from the refrigerator into a bowl. He looks at a piece of celery, but it's so wilted and has no strength for his purpose that he throws it down. He picks up other vegetables, but settles for the eggs and tomatoes. He closes the re- frigerator door and makes his way to the living room. We see BB lying on the floor, unconscious. Tilley sits down across from him with the bowl in his lap... he watches BB. BB starts to come to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a sick man! You smash my car, you steal my wife, and now you come to rob me! You're one demented human being. BB tries to focus on Tilley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to call the police and send you to jail... but I'm going to humiliate you first. Tilley throws an egg at BB and hits him in the head.     BB is groggy and confused and still drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do ya want to break into my house for? This ain't the fucking Rockefeller mansion! There ain't thirty-eight television sets here. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 115   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ain't saying 'Nelson, I think we've had a break-in... count the sets to see how many we've got left.' There ain't tons of jewelry hanging out of drawers... it ain't like I don't know which watch to put on, I got so many. I'm a working man, trying to make an honest living. What fucking morality you got, asshole?!! Tilley throws another egg at BB and hits him in the head again. Egg yolk drips down BB's face. He tries to get off the floor, but can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the craziest human being on the face of this earth! Tilley, getting ready with another egg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else do you want from me? Huh? What else?! I've got enough problems with the I.R.S. busting my balls and the Home Improvement Commission bullshit to contend with. I don't need aggravation from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody does this to me and lives! Nobody!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do ya like your eggs? Over easy? (picks up a tomato) Side of tomatoes? He throws a tomato.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to rue the day you ran into my car. This ain't the end... this is just the beginning. Tilley throws another egg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 106. 116   INT. POLICE STATION - NIGHT                                116 A POLICE OFFICER is interrogating Tilley behind the main desk of the police station. There's a lot of activity during this interaction... people coming and going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A guy breaks into my house and I'm being charged with assault? It makes no sense...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get it down right. The guy broke into your house, you hit him in the head with a gun, went to the refrigerator, took out eggs and tomatoes and threw them at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was defending myself... he was stealing from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't sound like defense to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to humiliate the guy. Here I am, out busting my ass all day making a decent living, I come home, and some schmuck is trying to steal from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you hit him with a gun, and pelted him with eggs and tomatoes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had some soup I would have thrown soup at him... is there any law you can't throw eggs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Babowski claims he didn't break into your house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did I do? Invite him in so that I could throw eggs at him? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 116   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe Mr. Babowski intended to break into your house, but these circumstances of the guy being pelted with eggs and tomatoes is something we need to look into. Tilley shrugs his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lucky that he didn't rob me last week, 'cos then my wife was living at home and we had all kinds of things in the fridge... I could have thrown barley soup, pumpkin pie, candied yams... yeah, he got off light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 117   EXT. POLICE STATION - DAY                                     117 Tilley and Sam exit the building. Seconds later BB and Bagel come out of the police station. Both pair of men head for their respective Cadillacs. BB has egg stains all over his suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe it, the man throws eggs at me and now I'm gonna have breakfast with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His partner says maybe the two of you can sit down and come to some kind of settlement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 118   INT. TILLEY'S CAR - DAY                                       118 Tilley is sitting in the driver's seat and Sam is next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I supposed to say to him? The man has been a pain in the ass since the day he rammed into my car. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 118   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just air your differences and we'll put an end to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 119   EXT. POLICE STATION - LONG SHOT OF POLICE STATION AND         119 TWO CADILLACS as they start to pull out of the parking lot. CUT TO: 120   INT. COFFEE SHOP - DAY                                        120 Tilley, Sam, BB and Bagel are sitting at a table together looking at menus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you what... I'll drop the charges against you, and we can wipe the slate clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See how quickly you can clear it up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't understand how the slate gets wiped clean when he breaks into my house and I'm the one charged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I wasn't breaking into your house. I was looking for your wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right... all right... I'm too tired... the slate's clean... the slate's clean. The WAITRESS approaches. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 120   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple of eggs over,   some hash browns, some toast --   toasted dark... butter on the   side, large grapefruit juice and   some coffee. The Waitress writes his order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On second thought, instead of the eggs over, if I ordered soft boiled eggs do you take them out of the shell or leave them in the shells? We can see that BB is getting a little irritable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We leave them in the shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like them that way because they get hot in the hand and it's hard to scoop the stuff out... it's not good... and you get little bits of shell in there and it doesn't taste good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just order some scrambled eggs and be done with it... all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I'm going to order, at least I ought to be content with my food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting a little hungry... I've got a headache as it is. Just order some eggs so some other people can have something to eat before the lunch trade comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do I need a guy telling me what I should or shouldn't eat? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 120   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not a four-star restaurant ... we're not having a gourmet meal... we're ordering breakfast, for Christ sake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It so happens I haven't been to this restaurant before. I don't know how they do their eggs... if they're over easy and they're gooey, I'm not happy with it... and I'm not happy if the soft boiled eggs are left in the shell...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have some French toast and a cup of coffee? (to Bagel) Bagel, what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! I'm ordering here. At least you can have the courtesy to let a man order his breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: French toast and a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, this guy gets on my nerves... from day one! I knew it then and I know it now. Tilley stands up from the table and starts to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm back to pressing charges against you! Tilley turns and is face-to-face with BB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to play that way? This game ain't over, mister... it ain't over... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 120   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands up.   The Waitress steps back and looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, you want to finish it now? You want to finish it right now? I'm ready... I'm ready now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're ready?! You're ready, that's what you're saying?! You're ready now?! I have to be intimidated... I have to be brought here to be intimidated...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't stand it any longer. You're driving me out of my mind. BB lunges for Tilley across the table, Sam and Bagel try to intervene -- the Waitress doesn't know what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, guys... take it easy... take it easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the people with the straitjackets... this man is out of control. Tilley and BB pull at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna finish it... we're gonna finish it. Bagel and Sam pull them apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, let's get out of here. Sam ushers Tilley to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not finished with him, Sam. (to BB) You heard me... I'm not finished with you, mister. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 120   CONTINUED:    (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He storms out of the coffee shop with Sam. Bagel sits back, looking relieved. BB composes himself. The Waitress nervously stands by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I'm having French toast and coffee. (to Bagel) Bagel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moe is in bed, still hooked up to tubes. His breathing is deliberate and he seems weak. The CAMERA SLOWLY PANS TO BB who is sitting by Moe's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moe, when you decided to marry May, how did you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did ya know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean to make up my mind to marry her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.     How did ya know? Moe shrugs his shoulders as if he doesn't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This Nora is a pain in the ass, Moe... a pain in the ass. It's worse now than when she used to be around. Moe smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna hear something? The other night at the Corral Club, I turned down a dance. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 121   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You turned down a dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the odds on that? You think you can come up with odds on that one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hundred to one BB don't dance... a hundred to one against. There's a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting out of the business,
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nora's friend. She looks up from the typewriter and sees BB. In his thick overcoat, huddled up, he seems a little lost, and it's obvious that he's looking for someone.

dialogue.raw_text: (calling across to Nora at the next desk)
